fork out (something).translation[0].defi: to spend a lot of money on something, not because you want to but because you have to
I had to fork out £600 on my car when I had it serviced.
We don’t want to have to fork out for an expensive meal.
fork out (something).translation[1].defi: to spend a lot of money on something, not because you want to but because you have to
Even more embarrassingly for the struggling bank, it had to fork out a further $2.4 million to end the agreement.
Companies will have to fork out for the extra equipment needed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
The company forks out a small fortune on telephone line rentals.
